result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Boyanz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Release for employment.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any
treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with victims. (TJ Maxx, Wal-mart, Co-actors, except Cassandra M.)
Provide DNA Sample if not previously done.

Case 15CF1170 was dismissed and read into: 15CM1740.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Jury Instructions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court.   Defendant Michael T Boyanz did not appear.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 03-21-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court.   Defendant Michael T Boyanz did not appear.   Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel withdraws his motion. Defense counsel stated that his client is locked-up in Milwaukee County and is requesting adjournment for the status of his client. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
dated today's filed by Attorney Rider; withdrawing motion and requesting to move to plea and sentencing.

Defendant Michael T Boyanz in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a Motion to Suppress date and have time to file that motion. Court orders counsel to have the motion filed by 12/11/2015 and once they are filed the clerks office to contact counsel to scheduled the motion.  Motion to be scheduled for 1 hour.
Hearing at 11-24-2015 03:00 pm

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael T Boyanz in court with attorney Nicole Buttery Williams for attorney Andrew Rider.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Motion for Substitution of Judge filed by defendant.
Public defender, Tedia Gamino, assigned to case.
Arraignment at 10-27-2015 10:00 am
Defendant Michael T Boyanz in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 10-15-2015 10:00 am

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witness/T.J. Maxx listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Michael T Boyanz in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
